DOC.brief_summary: Assessment effect BI 1356 Placebo prolongation QT interval
DOC.brief_title: Effect BI 1356 Single Dose QT Interval Healthy Female Male Subjects
DOC.criteria: Healthy male female , 21 50 year age Body mass index ( BMI ) range 18.5 29.9 kg/m2 Signed write informed consent prior admission study accordance Good Clinical Practice local legislation Any finding medical examination ( include blood pressure , pulse rate ECG ) deviate normal clinical relevance Gastrointestinal , hepatic , renal , respiratory , cardiovascular , metabolic , immunological hormonal disorder Diseases central nervous system ( epilepsy ) psychiatric disorder neurological disorder History orthostatic hypotension , faint spell blackouts Chronic relevant acute infection History allergy/hypersensitivity ( include drug allergy ) deem relevant trial judge investigator Intake drug long halflife ( > 24 hour ) within least one month less ten halflives respective drug enrolment study study Use drug might influence result trial 7 day prior enrolment study study Participation another trial investigational drug ( ≤ 60 day prior administration trial ) Heavy smoker ( > 10 cigarette > 3 cigar > 3 pipes/day ) Inability refrain smoke trial day Alcohol abuse ( > 60 g/day ) Drug abuse Blood donation ( ≥ 100 mL within four week prior administration trial ) Any deviation laboratory value consider clinical relevance Excessive physical activity within last week trial trial Hypersensitivity Moxifloxacin relate drug class Supine blood pressure screen systolic < 100 mmHg diastolic < 60 mmHg Heart rate screen > 80 bpm < 40 bpm Any screen ECG value outside reference range clinical relevance include , limited PR interval > 220 m , QRS interval > 115 m , QTcB QTcF > 450 m , QT ( uncorrected ) > 470 ms Subjects involve passenger transport operation dangerous machine For Female subject : Pregnancy positive pregnancy test , plan become pregnant study within 1 month study completion Pregnancy No adequate contraception study 1 month study completion , i.e . implant , injectables , combine oral contraceptive , IUD [ intrauterine device ] , sexual abstinence ( least 1 month prior enrolment ) , vasectomised partner ( vasectomy perform least 1 year prior enrolment ) , surgical sterilisation ( incl . hysterectomy ) . Females , vasectomise partner , sexually abstinent surgically sterile ask additionally use barrier contraception method ( e.g . condom , diaphragm spermicide ) Lactation period
